title: Exploring the Layers of Blockchain Technology
originBody: Blockchain Layers SMC Research · Follow 4 min read · 7 hours ago -- Blockchain technology is considered to be the future of everyday internet applications given its structure and development. In what has been a groundbreaking innovation in the 21st century, blockchain has changed the way we store and transfer information. However, the complexity and use of blockchain technology still burdens existing participants and persons who wish to interact with the blockchain ecosystem. In this article, we examine the fundamentals of a blockchain, how it works and the different layers that enable it to function. What is a Blockchain? Basically, blockchain is a distributed ledger that stores transaction records. It is a transparent and efficient tool for record-keeping where information can be verified and confirmed by anyone, at any point in time. This means anyone can access and view the transactions on a blockchain provided it's a public blockchain like Bitcoin or Ethereum. In addition, the blockchain is a decentralized, secure and immutable structure with no central authority, no single point of failure or origin to hack and no ability to make changes to transactions. It is decentralized and secure because a selected or random group of people (who fulfill the criteria for verifying and confirming transactions) validate transactions on the blockchain network. More so, blockchains operate through a network of computers working together to validate and record transactions in a series of blocks that form a chain. While blockchain technology has been popularised by the rise in cryptocurrency use, it is important to understand the layers responsible for its functionality and performance. Layers in a Blockchain There are five layers that enable the blockchain to operate successfully. First and foremost is the underlying infrastructure layer - layer zero, which is responsible for protocols and standards that govern the blockchain network. The network layer - layer one, involves the physical network of computers and nodes that communicate with each other to form the blockchain network. In addition, the second layer - the consensus layer ensures all nodes in the network agree on the validity of each transaction. More so, the data layer describes the third layer, which stores all transaction data in a secure and immutable manner. The fourth layer is the application layer which includes the smart contracts, decentralized application (dApps), and other software that run on top of the blockchain network. Finally, the fifth layer - the user layer - includes the end-users who interact with the blockchain network through wallets, browsers, and other applications. Understanding the blockchain layers fundamentally allows participants to understand the working mechanism of different blockchain networks. Explaining Blockchain Layers Layer 0 By default, layer zero is the blockchain. The real components that make-up the blockchain are the internet, hardware, and several other connections. Layer zero blockchain is the first stage of blockchain that ensures various networks to function, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, and many more. It also provides blockchain networks with a facility for cross-chain interoperability communication from top to different layers. It is the underlying infrastructure for blockchain. Layer 1 Layer 1 blockchain is a development from layer 0. In this layer, the blockchain network functions on a basic level. Scaling is limited here, and any changes or issues in a new protocol on layer 0 will affect layer 1. Examples of layer one blockchains are Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple, Solana, Fantom, and many more. Layer 2 Layer 2 tends to changes in layer zero. In specific blockchains, layer 2 is the scaling solution. It integrates with a third network to remove the limitation of layer 1. It is the most well-known approach to solve scaling issues of Proof Of Work (PoW) networks. Layer 3 This is the application layer. Primarily, layer 3 host the decentralized applications (DAapps) and many other protocols that enable other apps. In layer 3, the blockchain protocol is divided into two sub-layers - the application and execution layers. It is the most valuable solution developed to separate blockchains with cross-chain capabilities to achieve real interoperable operations. Conclusion Blockchain technology is potentially the needed tool to revolutionize industries and transform the way we conduct transactions. Understanding its layers provides businesses and investors the necessary information to leverage this technology’s benefits. By focusing on and improving the blockchain architecture, we can create a more secure, transparent, and efficient digital network. Did you find this helpful? originSummary: Blockchain technology is a distributed ledger that ensures transparency and security in storing transaction records.
The five layers of a blockchain are the infrastructure, network, consensus, data, and application layers.
Understanding these layers is vital for comprehending the functioning of blockchain networks and their potential to transform industries and enhance transaction processes.

title: OKX Wallet integrates with Injective for DeFi applications
originBody: Accessibility: Skip TopNav Flash News: OKX Wallet Now Integrated with Injective, a Blockchain Optimized for DeFi Applications dehaze search close rightElements.signin.Title RIGHTELEMENTS.REGISTER.TITLE search Flash News: OKX Wallet Now Integrated with Injective, a Blockchain Optimized for DeFi Applications November 20, 2023 04:10 ETSource: OKX FOLLOW Share SINGAPORE, Nov. 20, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- OKX, a leading Web3 technology company, has issued updates for November 20, 2023. OKX Wallet Now Integrated with Injective, a Blockchain Optimized for DeFi Applications OKX Wallet now supports Injective, an open, interoperable and smart contract-enabled blockchain designed to power the next generation of DeFi applications. With this integration, OKX Wallet users can easily view and transfer assets, including the INJ token, via the Injective network. OKX also recently announced that its Web3 wallet is now integrated with over 80 blockchains, marking a major step forward for its vision of creating the industry's most advanced and inclusive Web3 ecosystem. In addition to Injective, OKX Wallet also recently welcomed support for the following networks: X1 (a Zero-Knowledge Ethereum Layer 2 built with the Polygon Chain Development Kit (CDK) and OKX's new native network.) Manta KASPA dYdX Chain Celestia StarkNet Cardano Scroll opBNB SEI For more information, please visit the OKX Support Center. For further information, please contact: Media@okx.com About OKX A leading global technology company driving the future of Web3, OKX provides a comprehensive suite of products to meet the needs of beginners and experts alike, including: OKX Wallet: The world's most powerful, secure and versatile crypto wallet which gives users access to over 80 blockchains while allowing them to take custody of their own funds. The wallet includes MPC technology which allows users to easily recover access to their wallet independently, removing the need for traditional, 'written down' seed phrases. In addition, OKX Wallet’s account abstraction-powered Smart Account enables users to pay for transactions on multiple blockchains using USDC or USDT, and interact with multiple contracts via a single transaction. DEX: A multi-chain, cross-chain decentralized exchange aggregator of 300+ other DEXs and approximately 15 bridges, with 200,000+ coins and more than 20 blockchains supported. NFT Marketplace: A multi-chain, zero-fee NFT marketplace that gives users access to NFT listings across seven top-tier marketplaces including OpenSea, MagicEden, LooksRare and Blur. Web3 DeFi: A powerful DeFi platform that supports earning and staking on about 70 protocols across more than 10 chains. OKX partners with a number of the world's top brands and athletes, including English Premier League champions Manchester City F.C., McLaren Formula 1, The Tribeca Festival, Olympian Scotty James, and F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo. As a leader building innovative technology products, OKX believes in challenging the status quo. The company recently launched a global brand campaign entitled, The System Needs a Rewrite, which advocates for a new paradigm led by Web3 self-managed technology.
